alert.note: Alert for Northern Clearwater Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 10:17PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Intense snow showers will impact portions of northeastern Clearwater, southeastern Mineral, southern Missoula, northern Granite, north central Ravalli and central Powell Counties through 1115 PM MST/1015 PM PST/... At 1017 PM MST/917 PM PST/, Doppler radar was tracking intense snow showers along a line extending from near Ovando to 6 miles southeast of Bonner-West Riverside to 17 miles southwest of Tarkio. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-half mile or less and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Drummond, Lolo, Florence, Garnet, Nimrod, Finn, Helmville, Bearmouth, Lolo Hot Springs and Clinton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 119 and 155. Highway 93 S between mile markers 73 and 85. Highway 200 E between mile markers 51 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
